page.title: 04Principal Features
page.content: New Mills lies on two seperate sides of the valley. It used to be seperated by the river but they built the Union Bridge and last year we celebrated the centenary. There were childrens choirs and eight bands. The bridge cost Â£4,000 to build. It was built in 1883 and was opened in 1884, on June 7th. The Bridge scans The Torrs, a 75 feet deep gorge formed as a result of the Ice Age. The Torrs has been reclaimed and now is an ammenity. The town council has plans to provide picnic tables down The Torrs. The council has linked the network of riverside paths in New Mills with those further down the Goyt Valley.
